page.title: 01AREA OF STH. GODSTONE
page.content: Our designated area, approximately 20 miles from the centre of London, is a very rural site consisting of many farms, fields and country lanes. A busy trunk road, the A22 towards Eastbourne, passes through Sth Godstone. A school, church, and railway station are the main facilities here, beside a public house, a garage and a few shops. St. Stephen's School caters for approximately 230 children who travel from Blindley Heath and Godstone. Crowhurst has a beautiful old church with an ancient Yew tree in the grounds. The area has many beautiful walks, cropfields, pastureland and glades. Farms feature themselves prominently in the area, each with their own range of livestock.
